title:Pandapaxxy's Heresy Weapons
description:Based on https://www.reddit.com/r/sharditkeepit/comments/1j4yfku/heresy_weapon_breakdown/

// Adamantite
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Adamantine is our newest seasonal auto rifle and our first Strand support frame. The biggest draw with this weapon is Tear which provides Severing on precision final blows aiding your team and yourself. Reciprocity is useful if you're using this to heal teammates getting a very small bump back. Slice allows you to spread even more Sever on initial targets as well as not needing a critical kill depending on the faction could be easier on some than others." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Adamantite
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Adamantine is our newest seasonal auto rifle and our first Strand support frame. The biggest draw with this weapon is Tear which provides Severing on precision final blows aiding your team and yourself. Reciprocity is useful if you're using this to heal teammates getting a very small bump back. Slice allows you to spread even more Sever on initial targets as well as not needing a critical kill depending on the faction could be easier on some than others." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Adamantite (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Adamantine is our newest seasonal auto rifle and our first Strand support frame. The biggest draw with this weapon is Tear which provides Severing on precision final blows aiding your team and yourself. Reciprocity is useful if you're using this to heal teammates getting a very small bump back. Slice allows you to spread even more Sever on initial targets as well as not needing a critical kill depending on the faction could be easier on some than others." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Adamantite (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Adamantine is our newest seasonal auto rifle and our first Strand support frame. The biggest draw with this weapon is Tear which provides Severing on precision final blows aiding your team and yourself. Reciprocity is useful if you're using this to heal teammates getting a very small bump back. Slice allows you to spread even more Sever on initial targets as well as not needing a critical kill depending on the faction could be easier on some than others." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Adamantite
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Support frame auto rifles have not been the strongest in PvP but have small niche scenarios when in a full fireteam. Demolitionist or Pugilist will depend on your build but I generally find grenades stronger than powered melees. Kill Clip is really the only option in the final column as it provides enough of a boost after a kill to offset the slight hit registration delay and get you the second+ kill." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller
dimwishlist:item=2987244302&perks=839105230,3142289711,3523296417,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=2987244302&perks=839105230,3142289711,691659142,1015611457

// Adamantite
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Support frame auto rifles have not been the strongest in PvP but have small niche scenarios when in a full fireteam. Demolitionist or Pugilist will depend on your build but I generally find grenades stronger than powered melees. Kill Clip is really the only option in the final column as it provides enough of a boost after a kill to offset the slight hit registration delay and get you the second+ kill." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller

// Cold Denial
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Cold Denial is not the best pulse for PvE but can have some interesting utility if you prefer a lower zoom pulse. Ambitious Assassin works really well in your primary killing machine and perks like Swashbuckler or Desperado will enjoy the larger mags to plow through. Multikill Clip works against this but pairs better with Enlightened Action for bonus reload on hits." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Cold Denial
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Cold Denial is a returning weapon and one of my favorites from before Origin Traits. The low zoom meant it felt more like a hand cannon, but could do more damage and two-burst if you were capable. Arrowhead Brake fixes the recoil enough to be manageable in close ranges and accurate in longer engagements. This won't top the records for range but will be sticky within its intended range. Zen Moment and Headseeker are great neutral perks that offer the best for accuracy assistance and some forgiveness in each burst." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Cold Denial
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Cold Denial is a returning weapon and one of my favorites from before Origin Traits. The low zoom meant it felt more like a hand cannon, but could do more damage and two-burst if you were capable. Arrowhead Brake fixes the recoil enough to be manageable in close ranges and accurate in longer engagements. This won't top the records for range but will be sticky within its intended range. Zen Moment and Headseeker are great neutral perks that offer the best for accuracy assistance and some forgiveness in each burst." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

dimwishlist:item=558794124&perks=1482024992,1561002382,3436462433,699525795

// False Promises
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "False Promises is a returning auto rifle from yesteryear. It's a High-Impact frame with decent handling but pretty poor stability. There's not a lot you can do to improve that outside of directly investing or giving up a perk like Feeding Frenzy for Dynamic Sway Reduction. I wouldn't advise it unless you have a really hard time controlling the recoil. Cascade Point and Headseeker provide alternating utility through increasing rpm without a damage penalty or Stasis synergy. Depending on your build I'd personally go with Cascade Point because it feels more fun." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// False Promises
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Over in PvP False Promises has a bit more of a leg up. High damage per shot paired with a high range stat will cover most maps outside of scout rifle ranges. Cascade Point shows up here again as the firing delay is a whopping 40% dropping the time to kill from 0.83s to 0.50s. The requirements for a kill don't change at 6c but being far faster will catch people by surprise." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// False Promises
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Over in PvP False Promises has a bit more of a leg up. High damage per shot paired with a high range stat will cover most maps outside of scout rifle ranges. Cascade Point shows up here again as the firing delay is a whopping 40% dropping the time to kill from 0.83s to 0.50s. The requirements for a kill don't change at 6c but being far faster will catch people by surprise." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Whispering Slab
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Whispering Slab is a fan favorite bow. It has been a while since it saw usage as it got power crept pretty rapidly. Does it hold up now? Archer's Tempo and Vorpal Weapon are nothing flashy but it's honest work. Then you have the options of Swashbuckler and Pugilist or Adrenaline Junkie and Demolitionist. Depending on your build it could fit nicely. It's not anything crazy as a re-release, but most copies of the original aren't as good." Recommended MW: Draw Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Whispering Slab
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Lightweight Bows in PvP have not had a good footing starting from the health changes Bungie made. Opening Shot almost guarantees a crit and add in the bonuses from Lone Wolf and you might have a good solo weapon. It still doesn't feel incredible to miss a shot, so all these bonuses will hopefully make this bow feel adequate to use." Recommended MW: Draw Time.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Hollow Words
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Hollow Words was one of my favorite fusions for the looks alone. It felt cool back when our weapons didn't dip too deeply into the machabe (~~mechabre~~) or outer worldly. Rolling Storm gives you the easiest way to build Bolt Charges outside of subclass verbs. If you're amplified it halves the necessary requirements for getting to the maximum charges. Then you can unleash a thunderbolt on your next ability. Feeding Frenzy or Lead From Gold will depend on what you decide to pair with Hollow Words in order to maximize reloads or ammo." Recommended MW: Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Hollow Words
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Precision frame fusions have had an easier time in PvP due to their innate accuracy and easy recoil. Steady Hands provides 100 handling and 0.825x animation scalar after a kill on all your weapons. Slickdraw gives you the same handling amount but a lower percentage (0.95x), but it's all the time. If you plan on hoarding ammo and unleashing the beast then you should go for Steady Hands and Successful Warm-Up." Recommended MW: Range or Charge Time.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Psychopomp
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "What a fun little grenade launcher. Area denial where all the kills also build up your Bolt Charge. Ambitious Assassin gives you more chances for those kills. If you prefer less Arc synergy (look elsewhere????) then go for Unrelenting in the final column to get passive health back as unsuspecting Thrall walks through your pools." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Psychopomp (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "What a fun little grenade launcher. Area denial where all the kills also build up your Bolt Charge. Ambitious Assassin gives you more chances for those kills. If you prefer less Arc synergy (look elsewhere????) then go for Unrelenting in the final column to get passive health back as unsuspecting Thrall walks through your pools." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Psychopomp
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Area Denial grenade launchers have not been meta outside of Witherhoard because Witherhoard can stick. The area denial frames just leave a nice pool around them, but do even less tick damage than Witherhoard. I know you're giving up your exotic slot, but Witherhoard is a straight upgrade over the legendaries in PvP." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Abyssal Edge
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "The newest and arguably most accessible wave frame sword is Abyssal Edge. The heavy attack shoots you up while throwing a wave, similar to a wave frame grenade launcher, straight forward. Follow it up with a light attack and you'll aggressively fly forward. Slice is the easiest choice as you lower your targets damage output, nice for being so close and stomp mechanics doing so much damage. Add in Redirection or Surrounded for increased damage. Or Hatchling for better Strandsynergy and some added chip damage with some investments." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

dimwishlist:item=4221591387&perks=436053704,269888150,3705817207,831391274

// Abyssal Edge
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "The newest and arguably most accessible wave frame sword is Abyssal Edge. The heavy attack shoots you up while throwing a wave, similar to a wave frame grenade launcher, straight forward. Follow it up with a light attack and you'll aggressively fly forward. Slice is the easiest choice as you lower your targets damage output, nice for being so close and stomp mechanics doing so much damage. Add in Redirection or Surrounded for increased damage. Or Hatchling for better Strandsynergy and some added chip damage with some investments." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=547165496&perks=3666208348,269888150,923806249,3201496230

// Abyssal Edge (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "The newest and arguably most accessible wave frame sword is Abyssal Edge. The heavy attack shoots you up while throwing a wave, similar to a wave frame grenade launcher, straight forward. Follow it up with a light attack and you'll aggressively fly forward. Slice is the easiest choice as you lower your targets damage output, nice for being so close and stomp mechanics doing so much damage. Add in Redirection or Surrounded for increased damage. Or Hatchling for better Strandsynergy and some added chip damage with some investments." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Abyssal Edge (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "The newest and arguably most accessible wave frame sword is Abyssal Edge. The heavy attack shoots you up while throwing a wave, similar to a wave frame grenade launcher, straight forward. Follow it up with a light attack and you'll aggressively fly forward. Slice is the easiest choice as you lower your targets damage output, nice for being so close and stomp mechanics doing so much damage. Add in Redirection or Surrounded for increased damage. Or Hatchling for better Strandsynergy and some added chip damage with some investments." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Abyssal Edge
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "While swords aren't super popular in PvP, Tireless Blade gives you some easy ammo back after every other kill. Valiant Charge also allows you to launch forward after blocking for a short time. En Garde gives you a massive damage bonus to kill even roaming supers. Not as good as Assassin's Blade, but we don't have that." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=4221591387&perks=3666208348,269888150,2590710093,1685431615

dimwishlist:item=4221591387&perks=3666208348,269888150,2244851822,1685431615

// Eyes Unveiled
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Eyes Unveiled looks to be a decent contender if you don't have any precision frame linear fusion rifles collecting dust in your vault. Overflow, Triple Tap, and Field Prep are all ways to get ammo, either by doubling the magazine, giving ammo back, or holding more in reserves. Reservoir Burst also gives you extra damage and some AoE splash damage on the first (or overflowed) shot. Frenzy gives bonus damage on every shot after it activates, and Chain Reaction gives a lot of explosions. Pick your poison and pair it with the best alternate column." Recommended MW: Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=615373993&perks=839105230,689005463,3643424744,1427256713

// Eyes Unveiled
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Eyes Unveiled looks to be a decent contender if you don't have any precision frame linear fusion rifles collecting dust in your vault. Overflow, Triple Tap, and Field Prep are all ways to get ammo, either by doubling the magazine, giving ammo back, or holding more in reserves. Reservoir Burst also gives you extra damage and some AoE splash damage on the first (or overflowed) shot. Frenzy gives bonus damage on every shot after it activates, and Chain Reaction gives a lot of explosions. Pick your poison and pair it with the best alternate column." Recommended MW: Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Eyes Unveiled (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Eyes Unveiled looks to be a decent contender if you don't have any precision frame linear fusion rifles collecting dust in your vault. Overflow, Triple Tap, and Field Prep are all ways to get ammo, either by doubling the magazine, giving ammo back, or holding more in reserves. Reservoir Burst also gives you extra damage and some AoE splash damage on the first (or overflowed) shot. Frenzy gives bonus damage on every shot after it activates, and Chain Reaction gives a lot of explosions. Pick your poison and pair it with the best alternate column." Recommended MW: Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=4173311704&perks=839105230,689005463,3643424744,1427256713

// Eyes Unveiled (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Eyes Unveiled looks to be a decent contender if you don't have any precision frame linear fusion rifles collecting dust in your vault. Overflow, Triple Tap, and Field Prep are all ways to get ammo, either by doubling the magazine, giving ammo back, or holding more in reserves. Reservoir Burst also gives you extra damage and some AoE splash damage on the first (or overflowed) shot. Frenzy gives bonus damage on every shot after it activates, and Chain Reaction gives a lot of explosions. Pick your poison and pair it with the best alternate column." Recommended MW: Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Eyes Unveiled
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Linear fusions in PvP haven't been the most meta choice. They have a charge time. They need to be aimed. They're less ideal than a point and click-in-their-general-direction weapon like a rocket or grenade launcher. That's just how it goes. Withering Gaze is phenomenal for the times when you hit a limb or a torso instead of their head allowing you or your teammates a very easy follow up kill. Unfortunately there's absolutely nothing to aid Withering Gaze. Even Perfect Float is the best we have and that's mid at best." Recommended MW: Range or Charge Time.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=615373993&perks=839105230,689005463,2272927194,1134488199

// Eyes Unveiled
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Linear fusions in PvP haven't been the most meta choice. They have a charge time. They need to be aimed. They're less ideal than a point and click-in-their-general-direction weapon like a rocket or grenade launcher. That's just how it goes. Withering Gaze is phenomenal for the times when you hit a limb or a torso instead of their head allowing you or your teammates a very easy follow up kill. Unfortunately there's absolutely nothing to aid Withering Gaze. Even Perfect Float is the best we have and that's mid at best." Recommended MW: Range or Charge Time.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Eyes Unveiled (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Linear fusions in PvP haven't been the most meta choice. They have a charge time. They need to be aimed. They're less ideal than a point and click-in-their-general-direction weapon like a rocket or grenade launcher. That's just how it goes. Withering Gaze is phenomenal for the times when you hit a limb or a torso instead of their head allowing you or your teammates a very easy follow up kill. Unfortunately there's absolutely nothing to aid Withering Gaze. Even Perfect Float is the best we have and that's mid at best." Recommended MW: Range or Charge Time.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Eyes Unveiled (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Linear fusions in PvP haven't been the most meta choice. They have a charge time. They need to be aimed. They're less ideal than a point and click-in-their-general-direction weapon like a rocket or grenade launcher. That's just how it goes. Withering Gaze is phenomenal for the times when you hit a limb or a torso instead of their head allowing you or your teammates a very easy follow up kill. Unfortunately there's absolutely nothing to aid Withering Gaze. Even Perfect Float is the best we have and that's mid at best." Recommended MW: Range or Charge Time.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Temptation's Hook
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "The last returning legendary this season is also one of the first for many. A caster frame in Destiny 2. You won't really be getting a lot of close hits with this so Tireless Blade is the best for at-a-distance fighting. But if you are rough and tumble close, then Relentless Strikes becomes the easy choice. Attrition Orbs is nice if you chuck your heavy in the general direction of enemies to occasionally poop out and orb. Collective Action doesn't work with everything but when it gives you a nice boost you really feel it." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Temptation's Hook
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Caster frame swords feel like they should belong in the crucible. But it always feels like it's missing something. Either the animation is too long, the tracking is too slow, maybe the damage just isn't tuned right. Valiant Charge will help closing the distance if you use this and heavy attack a second person after lunging. Tireless Blade will give you some ammo back, but there's just something off." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Watchful Eye
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Ah that new aggressive frame we just got. Another fine addition. Watchful Eye has some standout traits that Pro Memoria didn't. The first being Overflow and Field Prep both allowing better ammo usage. Reconstruction is fine but slow. Then you've got Arc verbiage through Rolling Storm and Jolting Feedback. Both of which depend on whether you like Bolt Charges or Jolt. Neither is the wrong choice. But if you like any other subclass you should look for Killing Tally." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Ah that new aggressive frame we just got. Another fine addition. Watchful Eye has some standout traits that Pro Memoria didn't. // Watchful Eye (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Ah that new aggressive frame we just got. Another fine addition. Watchful Eye has some standout traits that Pro Memoria didn't. The first being Overflow and Field Prep both allowing better ammo usage. Reconstruction is fine but slow. Then you've got Arc verbiage through Rolling Storm and Jolting Feedback. Both of which depend on whether you like Bolt Charges or Jolt. Neither is the wrong choice. But if you like any other subclass you should look for Killing Tally." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
